translation:
Friend and Sir Almeida, São Lourenço, April 20, 1845.

That Your Mercy São Gabriel at Cristal, that the liquidation commission ended on May 8, and that all documents that were legalized would be paid, and that there was no limited amount for such; likewise that such documents, to be properly legalized, depend on the signature of one of the generals, or the chief.

Therefore, the two I previously sent through Your Mercy Viana, having Your Mercy taken them, I here would have them signed by Bento, and would send them by the same person who must depart from there on the 26th of the current month; finally nullifying the two documents that the same Viana already took, when the above that I pass to you is verified.

Thus, I further ask you to tell me anything if you know regarding such collection. We recommend ourselves to your family; and to Your Mercy

Your friend and obliged servant, Antônio Francisco dos Santos Abreu.

Postscript: Viana took documents from Your Mercy

One on March 15, 1835 — Amount of the yacht: 4:000$000

Same on October 12, 1836 — Same of 5 slaves from the Jaguarão estate: José, farmhand — 800$000; Joaquim, said — 700$000; Alberto, said — 600$000; Pedro, said — 700$000; Fermiano — 800$000

São Lourenço, April 20, 1845. Received on June 24, 1845. Answered on June 27, 1845.
